peril.views.slick.util

Class Region.Reducer

  • java.lang.Object
    • peril.views.slick.util.Region.Reducer
  • Enclosing class:
    Region

    private final class Region.Reducer
extends java.lang.Object
    The helper is designed to reduce a boolean[] from a specified width and height to the smallest possible boolean[] without loosing any data. This will minimise the storage space an increase the efficiency greatly. It also helps construct the parent class Region.
    Since:
    2018-02-17
    Version:
    1.01.01
    Author:
    Joshua_Eddy
    See Also:
    reduce()

      The initial width of the Region.

      Holds the lower x boundary.

      Holds the lower y boundary.
      private boolean[] toReduce
      The array that this Region.Reducer will shrink to save memory space.

      Holds the upper x boundary.
      private int upperYBoundary
      Holds the upper y boundary.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Reducer(boolean[] toReduce, int width, int height)
      Constructs a new Region.Reducer.Reduces a specified boolean[] from the specified width and height to the its smallest possible size without loss of data.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void getLowerXBoundary(int rowNum)
      Assigns lowerXBoundary by iterating through all the columns in the specified row.
      private void getLowerYBoundary(int colNum)
      Assigns lowerYBoundary by iterating through all the rows in the specified column.
      private void getUpperXBoundary(int rowNum)
      Assigns upperXBoundary by iterating through all the columns in the specified row.
      private void getUpperYBoundary(int colNum)
      Assigns upperYBoundary by iterating through all the rows in the specified column.
      boolean[] reduce()
      Shrinks the size of a specified boolean[] to its smallest possible size based on lowerXBoundary, lowerYBoundary, upperXBoundary and upperYBoundary.
      private void setXBoundaries()
      Assigns the outer horizontal boundary of the region of pixels.
      private void setYBoundaries()
      Assigns the outer vertical boundaries of the region of pixels.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Reducer

        public Reducer(boolean[] toReduce,
               int width,
               int height)
        Constructs a new Region.Reducer.Reduces a specified boolean[] from the specified width and height to the its smallest possible size without loss of data. This also assigns Region.width, Region.height, Region.position.
        Parameters:
        toReduce - The boolean[] to reduce in size.
        width - The initial width of the boolean[] array.
        height - The initial height of the boolean[] array.

    • Method Detail

      • reduce

        public boolean[] reduce()
        Shrinks the size of a specified boolean[] to its smallest possible size based on lowerXBoundary, lowerYBoundary, upperXBoundary and upperYBoundary. Assigns Region.position.
        Returns:
        boolean[] smallest version of the specified array.

      • setXBoundaries

        private void setXBoundaries()
        Assigns the outer horizontal boundary of the region of pixels.

      • setYBoundaries

        private void setYBoundaries()
        Assigns the outer vertical boundaries of the region of pixels.

      • getLowerXBoundary

        private void getLowerXBoundary(int rowNum)
        Assigns lowerXBoundary by iterating through all the columns in the specified row.
        Parameters:
        rowNum - The int index of the row currently being processed.

      • getUpperXBoundary

        private void getUpperXBoundary(int rowNum)
        Assigns upperXBoundary by iterating through all the columns in the specified row.
        Parameters:
        rowNum - The int index of the row currently being processed.

        private void getUpperYBoundary(int colNum)
        Assigns upperYBoundary by iterating through all the rows in the specified column.

        colNum - The int index of the column currently being processed.
